content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #96

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Clients may or may not differentiate retried messages from user actions. This app behavior is not mandated by FHIRcast.

Submitted by @MichaelTClifton on behalf of @isaacvetter (isaac@epic.com )
Chapter/section: Event Notification Request
Url:
Type: NEG :exclamation: Correction
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary: Clients may or may not differentiate retried messages from user actions. This app behavior is not mandated by FHIRcast.

Comment: FHIRcast doesn't dictate client's internal behavior or software architecture. The use of lower-case "should" is confusing because it's unclear if this is a requirement or not.

Existing wording: The event identifier should be used to differentiate retried messages from user actions.
Proposed wording: The event identifier can be used to differentiate retried messages from user actions.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

isaacvetter commented on Issue #96

During conversation at the Montreal, May 2019 working group meeting, @RicardoQuintano, @wmaethner, @NiklasSvenzen and myself talked through this issue and would like to propose:

Proposed resolution: Persuasive with Mod
Proposed wording: The event identifier MAY be used to differentiate retried messages from user actions.

wmaethner commented on Issue #96:

## :landline: II Working Group Vote (6-18-2019)
Block vote

@isaacvetter moved the following disposition, seconded by Ricardo Quintano Neira

Disposition: Persuasive with mod
Disposition Comment: Will fix as described in the issue comments or by the commenter

:+1: For: 10
:expressionless: Abstain: 2
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:
